meanings.definition: A type of fabric, typically made of cotton or wool.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a dress using soft winceys.
meanings.sent2: The store had a sale on colorful winceys.
meanings.sent3: The winceys danced in the breeze on the clothesline.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity soared as she transformed winceys into beautiful quilts.
meanings.sent5: The cozy winceys kept her warm on chilly nights.

meanings.definition: Plural form of wincey, referring to multiple pieces of the fabric.
meanings.sent1: The seamstress stacked various winceys on the table.
meanings.sent2: She purchased a bundle of lovely winceys for her project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the colorful winceys.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the scent of freshly washed winceys.
meanings.sent5: The tailor carefully folded the delicate winceys.

meanings.definition: To wince or flinch in pain or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: He winceys whenever he stubs his toe.
meanings.sent2: She winceys slightly when the needle pricks her skin.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke made the audience winceys in mock pain.
meanings.sent4: The memory of the accident always makes him winceys.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine made her winceys.
